title: susato_mikotoba
body:
Character from [[The Great Ace Attorney]]. Susato is [[Ryunosuke Naruhodo]]'s assistant.

Susato has [[black hair]] with [[bangs pinned back]] put into an [[updo]] with [[hair rings]] on both sides, tied with a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon]] and [[black eyes]]. 

She usually wears a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]], consisting of a [[japanese clothes|traditional]] [[pink kimono|pink]] [[kimono]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print kimono|print]] and [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[red skirt|re]][[red hakama|d]]/[[purple skirt|pur]][[purple hakama|ple]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[hakama skirt|hakama]] [[skirt]] with a [[waist bow]], along with [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] on her legs.

h4. See also
* [[Usato (Ace Attorney)|]]
* [[Ryutaro Naruhodo]]

title: zarana
body:
A fictional female character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toyline by [[Hasbro]], originally appearing in the [i]G.I. Joe[/i] comic series. 

[b]Zarana[/b] is a villainess, associated with G.I. Joe's nemesis [[terrorist]] organization, [[Cobra Command]]. She is a member of the [b]Dreadnoks[/b], a gang of destructive anarquists. 

A professional assassin, Zarana is an expert in disguise and the use of small arms, explosives and edged weapons. She is also the younger sister of [[Zartan]] and fraternal twin of [[Zandar]]. 

[[Lady Jaye]] is her nemesis.

title: lady_jaye
body:
A fictional female character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toy line, comic books, cartoon and live action film series. 

[b]Lady Jaye[/b] is a female [[military]] [[officer]] who is the G.I. Joe's team covert operations specialist. 

[[Zarana]] is her nemesis.

She debuted as a cartoon character and [[action figure]] in 1984 and was later introduced to the comics in 1985. Lady Jaye is also portrayed by actress "Adrianne Palicki":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrianne_Palicki in the 2013 live-action film [i]"G.I. Joe: Retaliation":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Joe:_Retaliation [/i].

title: official_alternate_costume
body:
[[Alternate costume]]s of official origin, whether it be from the creators themselves, or from second-parties involved in the given copyright. Generally a costume other than the standard one the character appears in.

These can often times appear in manga/anime (beach episodes, as one example), video games (whether as unlockables or as skins to be bought in gacha games), and on special events. Figures which can have such costumes include [[Virtual YouTuber]]s.

[b]Only[/b] use this tag for official costumes of the wearer themselves. If the character is wearing an official costume belonging to another character, use [[alternate costume]] or [[cosplay]] instead as applicable.

[b]Do not[/b] use this tag with [[alternate costume]], the tags are mutually exclusive.

h4. See also

* [[official alternate hairstyle]]
** [[official alternate hair length]]

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2022)
body:
The 2022 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]]. Her theme song is [b][[Future Eve (Vocaloid)|]][/b] by sasakure.UK.

This year marks the 10th Magical Mirai concert. The theme was "Future Retro" and this version of Miku was designed by [[noco_(adamas)|noco]], and main visuals by [[KEI (keigarou)|]].

She has [[aqua hair|aqua]]/[[blue hair|blue]] and [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] wore in [[twintails]] decorated with [[star hair ornament]]. [[aqua eyes|aqua]]/[[blue eyes|blue]] and [[pink eyes|pink]] [[gradient eyes]]. 

She wears a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]], [[collared dress|collared]], [[pink dress|pink]] and [[white dress]], with a [[pink necktie|pink]] and [[blue necktie|blue]] [[two-tone necktie]] and a [[belt]] with a [[heart]] ornament, a [[star (symbol)|]] ornament and a [[rocket ship]] ornament attached on the left. And [[pink footwear|pink]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]].

She also wears [[pink gloves|pink]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[two-tone gloves]], a [[thigh strap]], [[pink bow|pink]] and [[blue bow|blue]] [[two-tone bow]]s with [[pink ribbon|pink]] and [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[two-tone ribbon]] trails, a [[headset]] with a [[microphone]] and a [[radio antenna]] attached as additional accessories. 

She [[holding wand|carr]][[holding microphone|ies]] a [[star wand|star-shaped]] [[microphone wand]].

h4. Official art
* post #5526703
* post #5185541 (character sheet)

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: hyouka
body:
Hyouka is the first book of the [[Kotenbu series]], a  novel series by Yonezawa Honobu that was first published in Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko in 2001. It's also the title used for the anime adaptation of [[Kotenbu Series]] by [[Kyoto Animation]] in 2012.manga illustrated by [[task owner]].

The story follows a severely unmotivated high school freshman named [[Oreki Houtarou]] who prefers to "conserve energy" as much as possible. When his older sister asks him to join the Classic Literature club to save it from disbandment, he reluctantly agrees. There he meets [[Chitanda Eru]], who joins at the same time as him. His longtime friend [[Fukube Satoshi]] and acquaintance [[Ibara Mayaka]] end up joining as well, and together, the group begins to investigate an incident at their school that occurred 44 years ago. Hints of the mystery are buried in an old collection of works previously belonging to the former members of the Classic Literature club. The collection is titled “Hyouka”.

h4. Characters

title: key_(company)
body:
A visual novel/game studio under Visual Art's, known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. 

Their more well-known works include: [[kanon|Kanon]], [[air (visual novel)|Air]], [[clannad|Clannad]] and [[angel_beats!|Angel Beats!]]. 

Kanon was Key's debut release, which combined an elaborate storyline, a modern anime-style drawing style, and a musical score to help set the mood for the game. 

Key's second game was Air. It had a similar if not more complex storyline to Kanon and a more thorough gameplay. 

Key's third game was Clannad and is their longest work, comprising of over 62,800 text lines. The game consists of two story arcs in the game: the School Life arc, and the After Story arc (which is set 10 years after the School Life arc).

Both Kanon and Air were originally produced as adult eroges games(only Clannad was not), but had non-ero console ports released for the Dreamcast, PS2, XBox 360 and PSP. 

Four of Key's works, Kanon, Air, Clannad and Little Busters! have been made into anime. Key supervised the production of these anime titles while working with three animation studios [[Toei Animation]], [[Kyoto Animation]] and [[J.C. Staff|J.C.Staff]].

h4. Works:

* [[Kanon]]
* [[Air (visual novel)|]]
* [[Clannad]]
* [[Tomoyo After]]
* [[Planetarian]]
* [[Little Busters!]]
* [[Angel Beats!]]
* [[Rewrite]]
* [[Summer Pockets]]
* [[Prima Doll (Anime)]]

h4. See also

title: staff_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Star Allies]] and [[Kirby Fighters 2]] which lets [[Kirby]] wield a type of [[staff]] [[polearm]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[hat]] with a [[gold trim]] and has a [[blue gemstone]] in its center.

title: spider_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Star Allies]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[spider web|spider webs]] as [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[top hat]] with a [[spider web print|web]] and [[eye print]], making it resemble a [[spider]].

title: festival_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Star Allies]] and [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]] which lets [[Kirby]] deal loads of damage to all enemies on screen once by [[dancing]], the damage increasing for each Friend onscreen as well.

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[hat]] with a [[wing hat ornament|winged]] [[star hat ornament|star]] in its center and several [[hat feather|feathers]] lined up in a [[rainbow gradient]].

title: poison_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[poison|poison-based]] [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[snake]] [[headband]] with a [[skull hat ornament|skull]] in its center and a [[poison|poisonous fluid]] coming out of his head.

title: esp_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]] and [[Kirby: Star Allies]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[telekinesis|telekinetic]] [[energy ball|energy]] [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[baseball cap]] with a red [[visor]], often with a [[ribbon-trimmed headwear|ribbon trim]].

title: doctor_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]], [[Team Kirby Clash Deluxe]], and [[Super Kirby Clash]] which turns [[Kirby]] into a [[doctor]], letting him create one of four unique [[potion|potions]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]] with notable [[coattails]], a [[head mirror]] on a [[blue headband]], and [[round eyewear|round]] [[blue-framed eyewear|blue-framed]] [[glasses]].

title: circus_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]] and [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]] which lets [[Kirby]] use several [[circus|circus-themed]] [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[striped headwear|striped]] [[hat]] that resembles a circus tent with a notable [[clown nose]] and [[fake mustache]] on it.

title: bell_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]] and the [[Kirby Fighters 2|Kirby Fighters series]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[bell|bells]] as weapons.

When in this form, Kirby wears a large [[gold headwear|gold]] [[hat bell|bell as a hat]] with a [[star hat ornament|star]] in its center, as well as a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hat ribbon]] around the bell's ring.

title: beetle_kirby
body:
An occasional [[copy ability]] that appears throughout the newer entries in the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series which lets [[Kirby]] grab enemies, along with [[ground pound|ground pounding]] and cutting [[rope|ropes]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[helmet]] that resembles a [[beetle]] with a notable [[single horn|horn]] protruding from it, with a pair of [[insect wings|beetle wings]] in its back.

title: sand_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[sand|sand-based]] [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[crown]] that resembles [[pyramid|pyramids]] with a [[green gemstone]] in its center, with [[sand]] coming out of his head.

title: gaping
body:
An [[anus]] or [[pussy]] that stays open by itself, typically after sexual intercourse.

Be careful not to confuse this with [[invisible penis]] + a spread anus or pussy, which has the same visual effect of the orifice being spread open for no apparent reason. However, that occurs [i]during[/i] sex, whereas this tag is for afterwards.

h4. See Also

* [[cum in pussy]]
* [[spread anus]]

title: itano_circus
body:
An attack where a ridiculously large number of [[missile]]s are launched from one fighter [[jet]] or [[robot]] at a target or targets, regardless of tactical necessity. It's often characterized by the missiles' twisting, turning and crisscrossing [[contrail]]s, emphasized by the missiles or beam weapons firing along trajectories that are at an unlikely angle off of their target before making sudden turns in order to hit it (an effect that's been dubbed [b]Roboteching[/b] in the West).

Named after anime artist, animation director, and producer Itano Ichirou, and primarily comes from the anime franchise [[MACROSS]] and its [[choujikuu yousai macross|first series]] released in the early [[1980s (style)|80s]], with its origin series lending the additional name [b]Macross Missile Massacre[/b]. The sub-effect of 'roboteching' is named after MACROSS' westernized equivalent in [[ROBOTECH]].

title: merkava_(tank)
body:
Hebrew מרכבה, "chariot"   
Japanese メルカバ

The Merkava is the main battle [[tank]] of the [[Israel]]i Defense Force. The Merkava's diesel engine is located in front, allowing space for a 60mm internal [[mortar_(weapon)|mortar]] and a rear clamshell door. Other armament includes a 120mm main gun (in a distinctive tapering turret), a .50 caliber machine gun, 2 7.62mm machine guns, and self-protection dispensers.

h4.See Also:

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* External Link - "Wikipedia: Merkava":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merkava & "LAHAT":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LAHAT

title: asmr
body:
The acronym for 'autonomous sensory meridian response'. Basically low-grade euphoria that is experienced as a tingling sensation that begins at the scalp and moves down the spine. A genre of videos intended to induce ASMR has emerged, over 15 million of which had been published on YouTube by 2021, most of which serve to help listeners fall asleep. ASMR videos often use a [[binaural microphone]] for the best results.

ASMR can occur in multiple formats in illustrations:

* The acronym being displayed in faux YouTube text (post #4603304)
* A performer using the specified equipment to produce such videos (post #4792035)

Some common actions during ASMR:
* [[blowing in ear]]
* [[ear cleaning]]
* [[licking ear]]
* [[whispering]]

h4. See Also
* [[eargasm]]

title: implied_anal
body:
If it's ambiguous whether a character is having sex or not, use [[implied sex]].
If a character is having sex and it's obvious that it's anal (such as with a male) but you can't see the penetration, use [[anal]] and [[sex]].
If a character is having sex but you can't tell whether it's anal or vaginal, use [[sex]].


Same logic applies to [[implied fingering]] vs [[fingering]].

title: shirayuki_ren
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Chigusa Minori]], featured in [[Shino to Ren]].

She has [[pink eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]], and [[medium breasts]]. Wears a [[black hairband|black]] [[hairband]] & [[black choker|black]] [[choker]].

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[jacket]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], [[striped necktie|striped]] [[necktie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under skirt|under skirt]].

Canonically in a relationship with [[Saotome Shino (shino To Ren)|]].

Her name was decided by "Twitter poll":https://twitter.com/minori_chigusa/status/1455098925061271554, with 44.8% of 10159 respondents voting for Jun-chan (純ちゃん), and 55.2% voting for Ren-chan (恋ちゃん).

title: kim_chowon
body:
Playable character from [[Counter:Side]].

Kim Chowon is a sniper of Alphatrix Innovation who can quickly reuse the functions installed in her weapon.

She is a veteran mercenary who learned to hunt C.O. before she learned arithmetic. She has spent more than half of her life inside the Counterside while helping the mining of unauthorized groups outside the social boundary.

She is currently attending school to help improve the corporate image, but she is having a difficult time fitting into normal teenage life. Above all, everyone is too polite to her ever since she barehandedly subdued a Counter criminal who broke into the school and went on the rampage.

title: wing_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that gives [[Kirby]] wings that are able to make for smooth [[flying|flight]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[hat feather|feather]] [[bonnet]] in an [[indian style]], as well as has a pair of [[yellow wings|yellow]], [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[bird wings]]. In older games, Kirby also had a couple [[marking on cheek|markings on his cheek]].

title: michelle_(project_moon)
body: The real-world version of [spoilers][[Hod (Project Moon)|]][/spoilers] who worked for Lobotomy Corporation before the events of [[lobotomy corporation|the game]]. The youngest employee, she had short [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]], an [[ahoge]], and wore a [[lab coat]] with [[sleeves past fingers]].

title: plasma_kirby
body:
An occasional [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] charge up and fire [[electric beam|beams of electricity]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[gold headwear|gold]] [[circlet]] with a triangular-shaped [[blue gemstone]], and [[electricity]] constantly shoots out of his head. In older games, his skin would also turn [[green skin|green]].

title: ninja_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that turns [[Kirby]] into a [[ninja]] capable of wielding a [[katana]] and throwing [[kunai]].

This form has varied throughout the years, but in its modern form, Kirby wears a [[purple cloak|purple]] [[cowl]] along with a [[blue headband]] that comes with a studded [[star print|star]]. In older games, Kirby wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[hat]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[ponytail]] sticking out, and in some cases, take on a [[purple skin|purple]] hue.

title: mirror_kirby
body:
An occasional [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] use [[mirror|mirror-based]] attacks.

This form has varied over time, but in its modern form, Kirby wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[two-tone headwear|and]] [[purple headwear|purple]] [[hat]] along with a [[diamond (shape)|diamond-shaped]] [[wand]]. In older games, Kirby instead wore a [[red headwear|red]] [[two-tone headwear|and]] [[green headwear|green]] [[jester cap]] decorated with a [[star print|starry print]] and [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]] at its tips, as well as wielded a more spherical [[wand]].

title: yorna_mishigure
body:
A character from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]]. She is the Seventh ranking Divine General of the Sacred Vollachia Empire and the ruler of the Demon City of Chaosflame.

Yorna Mishigure is a [[tall]] woman with a thin physique. She has [[slit eyes|slit]] [[blue eyes]], [[white hair|white]] and [[orange hair]], [[fox ears]], and nine [[fox tail]]s.

She wears a colorful [[kimono]] and is usually holding a purple and golden [[kiseru]].

h4. External links
* "Re:Zero Wiki: Yorna Mishigure":https://rezero.fandom.com/wiki/Yorna_Mishigure

title: shushing
body:
Shush, the index finger of one hand is extended and placed vertically in front of the lips, with the remaining fingers curled toward the palm with the thumb forming a fist; used to demand or request silence from those to whom it is directed. Can be silent or accompanied by an audible "Sssh!" sound which alone has the same meaning.

h4. See also

* [[finger to mouth]]

title: heinrich_(iron_saga)
body:
[[Iron Saga]] character. The enigmatic CEO of OATH Company. She leaves all regular operations of the company to her subordinate, [[midori (iron_saga)|Midori]]. She shows herself as the exemplar of a Mercenary Ace before her employees, but many of them see her as their "reliable senior." Very few employees know she is the company's CEO.

title: thunderbolt_fantasy

A Taiwanese-Japanese Wuxia puppet series, based on the [[Pili Budaixi|Pili puppet]] show series. Created and written by [[Urobuchi Gen]], it is produced as a collaboration between Nitroplus and Good Smile Company and Taiwanese puppet production company Pili International Multimedia. The series was aired in Japanese in Japan, Mandarin Chinese in China and Taiwanese Min-nan in Taiwan.

title: pillory
body:
A device that restrains a person's torso and/or neck, and often the limbs as well. Often in the shape of two boards that lock together, with indentations for the victim's parts; for a representative example see post #4279357. Other designs exist as well, such as the curved design worn by [[briar_(league_of_legends)|Briar]].

For boards that only restrain the limbs, use the tag [[stocks]].

title: bi-han
body:
[[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] character. A [[ninja]] of the Chinese Lin Kuei clan, and the original [[Sub-Zero]].

In the first two timelines, he is the more sinister and ambitious counterpart of [[Kuai Liang]], his younger brother. He was killed by [[Scorpion (Mortal Kombat)|]] in the first Mortal Kombat tournament, his brother inheriting his title, before eventually becoming the ninja specter [[Noob Saibot]]. As such, depictions of Sub-Zero from the original Mortal Kombat, "Classic Sub-Zero":[https://twitter.com/therealsaibot/status/895301414620024832] from Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3, his associated "outfit":[https://mortalkombat.fandom.com/wiki/File:Sub-Zero_R1.jpg] in [[Mortal Kombat 9]], and all depictions of Noob are Bi-Han. In the [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]] meanwhile, he survives and remains Sub-Zero, becoming Lin Kuei Grandmaster, with his brother being Scorpion instead.

title: dollar_sign
body:
The [i]dollar sign[/i], also known as the [i]peso sign[/i], is a currency symbol consisting of a capital "S" crossed with one or two vertical strokes, used to indicate the unit of various currencies around the world, including most currencies denominated "peso" and "dollar".  Ex: US$, CA$, MEX$.

Most usages on Danbooru will likely be for US dollars.

title: new_taiwan_dollar
body:
The New Taiwan dollar (code: TWD; symbol: NT$, also abbreviated as NT) is the official currency of the [[Taiwan|Republic of China (Taiwan)]]. 

The basic unit of the New Taiwan dollar is called a yuan (圓) and is subdivided into ten chiao (角), and into 100 fen (分) or cents, although in practice both chiao and fen are never actually used. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: New Taiwan dollar":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Taiwan_dollar]

title: renminbi
body:
The renminbi (lit. 'People's Currency'; symbol: ¥; ISO code: CNY; abbreviation: RMB) is the official currency of the [[China|People's Republic of China]].

The yuan (Chinese: 元 or simplified Chinese: 圆; traditional Chinese: 圓; pinyin: yuán) is the basic unit of the renminbi, but the word is also used to refer to the Chinese currency generally, especially in international contexts. One yuan is divided into 10 jiao (Chinese: 角; pinyin: jiǎo), and the jiao is further subdivided into 10 fen (Chinese: 分; pinyin: fēn).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Renminbi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renminbi]
* "Wikipedia: Yuan (currency)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuan_(currency)]

title: kuai_liang
body:
[[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] character. A [[ninja]] of the Chinese Lin Kuei clan.

In the first two timelines, he inherited the mantle of [[Sub-Zero]] following the death of the first Sub-Zero, his older brother [[Bi-Han]], becoming Lin Kuei Grandmaster in the process. He would help the heroes of Earthrealm on numerous occasions, even when that meant fighting his own clan. As such, all main depictions of Sub-Zero that aren't explicitly Bi-Han, from Mortal Kombat 2 to [[Mortal Kombat 11]], are Kuai Liang. In the [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]] meanwhile, he has become [[Scorpion (mortal kombat)|]]. [spoiler]Due to the events of MK1, he would leave the Lin Kuei and form the Shirai Ryu, named after his wife, [[Harumi Shirai]]. The original Scorpion, [[Hanzo Hasashi]], would join the Shirai Ryu as a kid.[/spoiler]

title: she_is_beautiful
body:
A 2022-to-Present sci-fi mystery manga series by Esaka Jun and illustrated by [[Totsuno Takahide]].

The series follows Kurumi, a girl raised by the mysterious institute, Familie.  At this institute girls are raised from birth in various fields from the arts to firearms. The girls at the age of 10 are assigned to specialized classes and Kurumi hopes that she will be assigned to the arts class alongside her close friend Hikari.  Going to sleep on her 10th birthday, Kurumi awakes to find that 14 years has passed and she's now staying in a remote forest cabin with her former classmate Sayaka; a girl she didn't get along with.  With no memories of what has happened, can she trust what Sayaka is telling her has happened.

h4. Characters

* [[Kurumi_(She_is_Beautiful)|]]

title: sub-zero
body:
[b]Sub-Zero[/b] is a character in the [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] series. A [[ninja]] of the Chinese Lin Kuei clan, Sub-Zero has command over the element of ice, and has the ability to freeze his foes solid.

Two people have taken the mantle of Sub-Zero. The first, [[Bi-Han]], was killed by [[Scorpion (Mortal Kombat)|]] in the first Mortal Kombat tournament before eventually becoming the ninja specter [[Noob Saibot]]. He would be succeeded by the second Sub-Zero, [[Kuai Liang]], his younger brother. In the third MK timeline, as introduced in [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)]], Bi-Han's fate is changed, and he remains Sub-Zero. His brother, meanwhile, is now Scorpion.

In [i]Shadow Dragon[/i], the lance is stolen by Grust and given to [[Camus (Fire Emblem)|]]. In [i]Mystery[/i], it is instead wielded by [[Hardin (Fire Emblem)|]] as the [[hardin (dark emperor) (fire emblem)|Dark Emperor]].

title: mysterious_man_(fire_emblem)
body:
Bruno, initially identified as the Mysterious Man, is a secondary antagonist in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. He is an enigmatic man who occasionally appears before the Order of Heroes.

He is a prince of Embla, he and his mother were despised by the royal family. Eventually claiming she shared imperial secrets with Askr, they imprisoned her, causing her to die in isolation, while he himself was banished to the border despite only being a child.

In his first appearance in Chapter 9, he faces the Order of Heroes at first, but eventually aids them, as he warns about Veronica's attack on their summoning grounds. Later, he claims to have knowledge about Zacharias, but refuses to say anything more before disappearing.

[spoilers]In reality, he IS Zacharias, which was an alias used by Bruno to get closer to the Askran royal family.[/spoilers]

title: shinano_(kancolle)
body:
The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[aircraft carrier|supercarrier]] of the same name as she might be depicted in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i].

[i]Shinano[/i] has yet to be added in [[Kantai Collection]], but there seems to be a chance of her to be implemented due to a design (drawn by the artist Youki) of her appearing in the official [[doujinshi]] books [i]Teitoku no Natsuyasumi[/i] and [i]Teitoku no Fuyuyasumi[/i] with the pages of her being titled "Future Asset". The two books were released in 2013, and as of yet is not in the game.

In [i]Teitoku no Natsuyasumi/Fuyuyasumi[/i] she has [[long hair|long]] dark [[brown hair]] in a [[single braid]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]], generic green and red [[Japanese clothes]], and a [[yugake]]. She wields a [[bow (weapon)|bow]] and her [[flight deck]].

This tag will be used if she is officially implemented into the game, but for now this tag is used for either fan designs or her [i]Teitoku no Natsuyasumi/Fuyuyasumi[/i] design.

h4. History

The historical [i]Shinano[/i] was laid down May 4, 1940. She was originally planned to be the third "[i]Yamato[/i]-class battleship":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamato-class_battleship, but after the loss of the aircraft carriers "[i]Akagi[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Akagi, "[i]Kaga[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Kaga, "[i]Hiryuu[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Hiryū, and "[i]Souryuu[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Sōryū after the [[Battle of Midway]] she was converted into a supercarrier as her hull was partially incomplete.

In theory, [i]Shinano[/i] was capable of fielding the largest airwing of any aircraft carrier constructed by the end of World War II and was kept secret as she was meant to be a strategic surprise. However, due to the advanced state of her construction as a battleship before conversion, [i]Shinano[/i] has a dispropotionally small hangar size of 47 aircrafts (in comparison, the light aircraft carrier [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]] accommodated 48 aircrafts despite her displacement is almost 7 times less than that of Shinano's). Due to this, the IJN planned to use [i]Shinano[/i] as a support carrier to tend the other fleet carrier's air wings.

[i]Shinano[/i] was launched October 8, 1944 (originally planned to launced May 1945, but her construction was expedited due to the "Battle of the Philippine Sea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Philippine_Sea)]) and commissioned November 19, 1944. [i]Shinano[/i] was dispatched from Yokosuka to Kure with an inexperienced crew to finish her fitting out and embark her aircraft, but she was sunk en-route by  "[i]USS Archerfish[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Archerfish_%28SS-311%29 on November 29, 1944. [i]Shinano[/i] was the the largest warship ever sunken by a submarine.

[i]Shinano[/i] was named after the old "Shinano Province":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinano_Province], now modern day "Nagano Prefecture":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagano_Prefecture].

h4. See also

* [[Shinano (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Shinano (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Shinano[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Shinano

In this form, Kirby wears a pair of futuristic [[white-framed eyewear|white]] or [[grey-framed eyewear|grey]] [[goggles]].

title: hi-jump_kirby
body:
An occasional [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that allows [[Kirby]] to jump incredibly high, destroying any enemy in the way.

In this form, kirby wears a [[wing hat ornament|winged]], [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[circlet]] and a [[blue cape|blue]] and [[red cape|red]] [[cape]].

title: freeze_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Adventure]] and [[Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land|its remake]], as well as [[Kirby's Dream Course]], [[Kirby Air Ride]], and [[Kirby Canvas Curse]] where [[Kirby]] [[frozen|freezes himself]] in an [[ice|icy]] barrier.

In this form, Kirby wears a [[blue coat|blue]], [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[parka]] with the [[hood up]].

title: beam_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|Kirby]] series where [[Kirby]] becomes able to fire a [[energy beam|beam]] out of a [[wand]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[two-tone headwear|two-tone]] [[jester cap]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]] at the tops that is half [[red headwear|red]] and half [[orange headwear|orange]], the latter of which is decorated with a [[star print]]. He also wields a magic [[wand]]. In some games, Kirby's skin also takes on a [[yellow skin|yellow]] hue.

title: ball_kirby

Not to be confused with the very similar form Kirby takes in [[kirby canvas curse|Canvas Curse]].

title: hi_no_tori_2772
body:
[b]Phoenix 2772[/b] ([i]Hi no Tori 2772: Ai no Kosumozōn[/i] - [i]Firebird 2772: Love's Cosmozone[/i]) is an animated feature film directed by Sugiyama Taku and co-scripted by [[Tezuka Osamu]], based on his manga series [[Hi no Tori]]. The epic science fiction and fantasy film premiered on March 15, 1980 in Japan.

It was then released in the UK in 1980 under the title [i]Space Firebird[/i], and later in the United States in 1983, shortened to 79 minutes and dubbed by British voice-actors. A French version had also been released under the title [i]Firebird 2772[/i].

h4. See also

* [[Olga (phoenix 2772)|]]

title: kirby:_triple_deluxe
body:
The first [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] game for the [[Nintendo 3DS]], released in 2014. Following the trend set by [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]], this game takes a relatively safe approach with traditional gameplay mechanics. The central mechanic this time around is the new Hypernova ability, which boost Kirby's Inhale to ridiculous proportions.

Kirby was chilling in Dream Land one day when a giant Dreamstalk suddenly grows from underneath his house! He goes to Castle Dedede to investigate, but before he could confront [[King Dedede]], a [[taranza|mysterious spider mage]] appears from behind and captures the king. Kirby immediately gives chase, starting an uphill adventure!

h4. Characters

* [[Kirby]]
* [[King Dedede]]
* [[Taranza]]
* [[Queen Sectonia]]

h6. Bosses

* [[Flowery Woods]]
* [[Paintra]]
* [[Kracko]]
* [[Coily Rattler]]
* [[Pyribbit]]
* [[Masked Dedede]]
** [spoiler][[Shadow Dedede]][/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Dark Meta Knight]] (Post-Game only)[/spoiler]
* [[Queen Sectonia]]
** [spoiler][[Soul of Sectonia]] (True Arena only)[/spoiler]

title: mikumo_guynemer
body:
A character from [[Macross Delta]], she is an [[idol]] and leader of  [[Walkure (macross delta)|]], and is nicknamed [b]Mysterious Venus[/b]. She has [[red eyes]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

She is voiced by two [[voice actor]]s - [[Koshimizu Ami]] voices her dialogue, while [[JUNNA (singer)|]] provides her singing voice.

[spoiler]Despite being the most physically mature member of the group, she is actually the youngest, as she is an artificial clone created only 3 years before the series takes place.[/spoiler]

title: gial_ackbar
body: Fleet Admiral Gial Ackbar is a fictional character from the [[Star Wars]] franchise. A member of the amphibious Mon Calamari species, Ackbar was the foremost military commander of the Rebel Alliance, and led the attack against the second [[Death Star]] in [[Star Wars: Return of the Jedi]] (1983), Admiral Ackbar's line, "It's a trap!", which he says during the Battle of Endor in Return of the Jedi, became one of the most famous and beloved lines from the original Star Wars trilogy, the line has become a popular internet [[meme]].

title: akadora
body: Specifically marked red dora tiles. If included in the game, these "red fives" automatically count as dora, regardless of the dora indicator. If the dora indicator is a four, the red five of the same suit counts as two dora. Most modern sets will include two red 5p, one red 5m, and one red 5s, and one red five of each suit is used in actual play.

title: suushiihou
body: The two wind-based yakuman: shousuushii 「小四喜」 and daisuushii 「大四喜」. Both involve all four wind tiles. Shousuushii requires three groups winds, and a pair of the last wind, while daisuushii requires groups of all four. Both are worth yakuman, though daisuushii can be worth double yakuman if a ruleset allows it.

title: legs_together
body:
Legs held together along their entire length, with no or minimal separation between them.

The legs may or may not be [[crossed_legs|crossed]], and it doesn't matter if the character are [[lying]], [[sitting]], or [[standing]]. A [[thigh gap]] may be present depending on the character's proportions. Contrast with [[legs apart]] and [[spread legs]].

If a character's legs are touching at the knees but their feet aren't touching, use [[knees together feet apart]] instead.

If a character's knees and toes are touching, but their calves and heels are apart, do not use [[legs_together]].  [[Pigeon-toed]] is likely the proper tag.

If a character's legs aren't entirely visible but appear to be together, use your best judgment when determining whether to use this tag. A good example of legs touching is post #2620773.

h4.See also

* [[seiza]]
* [[yokozuwari]]
* [[knees_together_feet_apart]]
* [[tag group:posture]]

title: yoshino_chidori
body:
The only female member of Strega, a team of three acting as the antagonist team in [[Persona 3]] and its re-releases.

Chidori has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] and wears [[white dress|white]] [[lolita fashion]]. She is commonly seen drawing sketches in the park until [[Iori Junpei]] meets her. She also has a bad habit of cutting herself though the wounds quickly heal, provided by her persona Medea.

In battle, she uses an [[axe]] on a [[chain]].

The original manga was followed up with a sequel in [[Hades Project Zeorymer Omega]].

title: pioneer_movement
body:
A mass youth organization for children of age 10-15, descendant from the [[Scout movement]] (as well as the Sokol movement) and originating in communist countries, the first being the Soviet Pioneers.

Adapted from the [[Scout uniform]], the traditional item of clothing worn by a pioneer is the [[Pioneer neckerchief]], typically in red.

title: edo_jidai
body:
The [b]Edo Jidai[/b], also known as the [b]Tokugawa Jidai[/b], was a time period in the history of feudal [[Japan]] from the year 1603 until 1867. It took place after the [[Sengoku Jidai]] and during this time Japan was unified and ruled by the [[tokugawa ieyasu|Tokugawa shogunate]], which closed the country to any foreign influence. The period ended with the [[Boshin War]] and the Meiji Restoration, events typically viewed as the start of modern Japan.

During the Edo period most [[samurai]] traditions and customs were refined to the extent that can be seen today in contemporary modern Japan.

title: boshin_war
body: A civil war fought in [[Japan]] from 1868-1869 between the [[edo jidai|Tokugawa Shogunate]] and forces seeking to restore Imperial power. Resulted in the overthrow and ending of the shogunate and the Meiji Restoration.

title: zenryoku_cheerleader_(idolmaster)
body: "Zenryoku Cheer Girl" is one of the costumes from The Idolmaster Million Live. This costume is worn by the idols when they perform cheerleading routines. It is characterized by its vibrant and energetic design, which highlights the active side of the idols. Some idols have even performed solo live shows in this costume. In addition, merchandise such as keychains of idols wearing this costume are also sold. Zenryoku Cheer Girl can be said to be a costume that fully brings out the charm of The Idolmaster Million Live.

title: senkou_hanabi_dan
body:
Flash☆HANABI Squad, or Senkou☆HANABI Dan in Japanese, is a unit that appears in the smartphone app “The Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days”. The unit consists of the following five members:

Takayama sayoko  (CV:Komagata yui)
Yokoyama nao  (CV:Watanabe yui)
Kousaka umi  (CV:Ueda reina)
Satake minako (CV:Ozeki eri)
Fukuda noriko (CV:Hamasaki nana)
They are the only five-member unit in the Idolmaster Million Live! series. They also perform a song named “Flash☆HANABI Squad”. This unit is very popular among fans of the Idolmaster Million Live! series.

title: reverse_bunnysuit
body:
A [[meme attire|memetic]] [[reverse outfit]] that resembles a [[Playboy bunny]] outfit, but with bare skin in place of the leotard. The torso is bare while the arms and legs are covered, resulting in negative space resembling a leotard where the leotard would normally go.

Other aspects of the [[Playboy bunny]] outfit are still normally present, including [[rabbit ears]], a [[rabbit tail]], [[fishnet thighhighs]], [[pantyhose]] or [[latex legwear]], [[wrist cuffs]], a [[detached collar]], and [[high heels]]. The leotard is usually replaced by a [[shrug (clothing)|shrug]] or [[cropped jacket]], with [[pasties]] occasionally covering the [[nipples]]. The pantyhose becomes [[crotchless pantyhose]], with [[maebari]] or [[strapless bottom]] occasionally covering the [[pussy]].

Originally first found in 2014 (post #1766182), but went viral in 2020. It's not exactly known what's the picture that began the meme, but it can be safely assumed that post #3701575 is the one that put most of the spark, given its popularity on both Twitter and Pixiv. 

A sub-meme was created by [[Touhou]] fanartists, featuring [[Usami Renko]] and [[Maribel Hearn]]; usually the artwork features Renko wearing a reverse bunnysuit with bunny pasties, while Maribel is in the background, accompanied with the description "Renko working at a shady part-time job recommended by a friend" (友人に勧められた怪しいバイトに勤しむ蓮子ちゃん).

h4. See also

* [[playboy bunny]]
** [[male playboy bunny]]
* [[meme attire]]
* [[reverse outfit]]

title: kuchisake-onna
body:
An old Japanese legend-turned-urban legend of a woman who had her face cut up (either by her husband or by failed plastic surgery), and her [[ghost]] haunts young people. 

She wears a face mask and asks people if she looks pretty. 

If they answer "No" she immediately kills them with a scythe or scissors. If they answer "Yes", she takes the mask off, revealing her horribly cut face, and asks "How about now?", before killing them

In other versions of the tale she says "Wanna know how I became like this?" after taking the mask off, and cuts the face of the victim making them look like her (especially if they are young women).

There are supposedly two ways of escaping her. One is responding "You are somewhat attractive to me" or just "So so", which may confuse the ghost and give you time to escape. The other way is by repeating everything she says, which may cause her to disappear. 

h4. See also

* [[Glasgow smile]]
* [[Hasshaku-sama]]
* [[Mary-san]]
* [[Kuchisake-onna (Ishiyumi)]]

title: av-11d_bronco_ii
body:
The [b]AV-11D Bronco II[/b] is a fictional variable geometry aerospace combat [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] anime TV series from the 80s.

It was [[Katsuragi Kei]]'s original ride before the [[Orguss (mecha)]].

[spoiler]The remains of its main superstructure as well as its legs and wings were used to develop the more advanced [[Orguss (mecha)]] after the Bronco was damaged beyond repair during an early battle.[/spoiler]

title: mlover
body:
A fictional mecha from the  [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[science fiction]] TV anime series from the 80s. 

The [b]MLover[/b] is an advanced [[Emaan]] [[mecha]] usually used to defend their trading caravans and fleets. 

It is very fast and maneuverable, but also light armored. The MLover posseses two manipulator arms but lacks any legs. It is armed with an energy [[gunpod]], a rotary [[energy gun]] and several [[rocket_launcher|missile launchers]]. [spoiler]Some of its components and its arms were later used during the construction of the [[Orguss (mecha)]].[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: orguss_(mecha)
body:
The titular [[mecha]] of [[choujikuu_seiki_orguss|The Super Dimension Century Orguss]] TV series.

The [b]Orguss[/b] is an advanced variable mecha that can transform into 4 different modes which are [[starfighter|fighter]], [[gerwalk]], [[tank]] and giant robot mode. It is [[Katsuragi Kei]]'s mecha of choice. [spoiler]The Orguss was developed from the remains of another mecha called the [[AV-11D Bronco II]] after it was damaged beyond repair. It also has the arms and some components of an [[MLover]] [[Emaan]] mecha attached to it.[/spoiler]

In [[real life]] it was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4. See also

* [[Orguss Olson Type]]

title: meiner_fanrong_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Meiner" is a kanmei. German: "My" (masculine) + Chinese: "Prosperity"[/tn]

Real-life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Meine Theresia (racehorse)|]]. He is [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]]'s elder brother.

title: uberleben_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]German: "Survival"[/tn]

Real-life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Meine Theresia (racehorse)|]].  She is well known for being the winner of the 2021 Yushun Himba (The Oaks) as well as her rivalry with [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]], the first true white horse to have won a G1 race and winner of the 2021 Oka Sho (1000 Guineas).

Uberleben has a black coat with a small, white diamond-shaped "star" on her forehead and a coronet on her right back leg. She is almost always seen wearing a blue hood with a white "T" on the forehead section, shared by many horses trained by the same trainer.

At the time of the 2021 Shuka Sho, the third crown race for fillies, Gallop (a horse racing magazine) played the Sodashi/Uberleben rivalry with a "White vs. Black" frontpage. However, neither won the race. [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]] (effectively "Red") became the winner of the third crown. Akaitorino Musume ("Daughter of the red bird", i.e. of Apapane) is also the reason for her strange nickname of "Shiroiare no Musume" ("Daughter of the [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|white thing]]").

In the subject of horse racing news coverage, she is seemingly cursed to often have the wrong info, the wrong picture or some weird typo whenever she becomes the subject. "Here's many samples of that phenomenon.":[https://wikiwiki.jp/sppenpen/%E3%83%A6%E3%83%BC%E3%83%90%E3%83%BC%E3%83%AC%E3%83%BC%E3%83%99%E3%83%B3] (In Japanese)

She unexpectedly retired in March 2023 due to tendinitis and is set to become a broodmare at Big Red Farm alongside her sire.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], she is the RL daughter of [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)]], one of the most popular characters in the franchise. Thus, she is a popular choice for original umamusume. She is often depicted in this manner in a blue and white outfit (similar to her hood) or a red and green one (that is, in "Meiner" colors), typically in some form of marine (due to Gold [b]Ship[/b]) or military outfit.

title: obey_me!:_one_master_to_rule_them_all!
body:
An ikemen romance simulation and RPG card mobile game for iOS and Android produced by NTT Solmare Corp. It is one of many otome games from a dating sim brand called Shall We Date? The player is a human exchange student at Devildom, a school in the underworld for demons, and is tasked with assisting the student council. There are currently 12 dateable characters with a group of brothers, avatars of the Seven Deadly Sins, at its core.

h4. In-Game Characters
h5.  Demon Brothers
([i]listed oldest to youngest[/i])
* [[lucifer_(obey_me!)|Lucifer]] (avatar of pride)
* [[mammon_(obey_me!)|Mammon]] (avatar of greed)
* [[leviathan_(obey_me!)|Leviathan]] (avatar of envy)
* [[satan_(obey_me!)|Satan]] (avatar of wrath)
* [[asmodeus_(obey_me!)|Asmodeus]] (avatar of lust)
* [[beelzebub_(obey_me!)|Beelzebub]] (avatar of gluttony)
* [[belphegor_(obey_me!)|Belphegor]] (avatar of sloth)

h5. Other Demons
* [[Diavolo (obey me!)|]]
* [[Barbatos (obey me!)|]]
* [[Mephistopheles (obey me!)|]]

h5. Angels
* [[luke_(obey_me!)|Luke]]
* [[simeon_(obey_me!)|Simeon]]
* [[raphael (obey me!)|Raphael]]

h5. Humans
* [[Yuki (Obey Me!)|Yuki]] (MC; player's character)
* [[Solomon (obey me!)|]]

h5. Other Characters
* Helene (human trapped in a painting)
* Thirteen (reaper)

title: transparent_censoring
body:
Censoring which is not opaque, leaving the details behind it visible to close inspection. Often takes the form of a [[bar censor]], but also exists in other forms.

If the censoring is so transparent as to make it ineffective, it may also be [[pointless censoring]].

title: panic!_at_the_disco
body:
[b]Panic! At The Disco[/b] was a former American Alternative Pop Rock led by lead vocalist Brendon Urie. Forming in 2004, the band has spawn several Hit Songs including "I Write Sins Not Tragedies",  "But It's Better If You Do" and "High Hopes". 

Due to the band's constant change of band members and Urie focusing on his solo career and family life, Panic! At The Disco was disbanded in 2023.

title: data_(star_trek)
body:
A character from [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]. A lieutenant-commander in the operations branch of Starfleet stationed on the [[uss enterprise ncc-1701-d|USS Enterprise]], he is a Soong-type [[android]] who wishes to be human and experience emotions, and thus tries to understand the behaviors of humans. His personality is clearly supposed to resemble that of someone on the autism spectrum.

He has [[pale eye|pale]] [[green eyes]], [[brown hair|brown]] [[hair slicked back|slicked back]] hair and wears a yellow 2360s-era [[starfleet uniform]]. He is portrayed by the American actor Brent Spiner.

h1. External links
* "Memory Alpha":[https://memory-alpha.fandom.com/wiki/Data]
* "Star Trek":[https://www.startrek.com/database_article/data]

title: seaport_summer_princess
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] enemy [[abyssal ship]] introduced in the Summer 2016 Event. Her voice actress is unknown. She is based on Singapore.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] [[hair over one eye|covering the left side of her face]] and [[blue eyes]]. Wears a [[white dress]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[sun hat]] with a large black [[hat flower|flower on it]]. Her [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high_heel_boots|high heeled]] [[armored_boots|armored]] [[thigh_boots|thigh boots]] comprised of [[machinery]] appearing to be part of her actual body. She rides on a large monster and has small cutesy familiars. Alongside her is a beach bag, umbrella, and a plate with a drink on it.

title: akagi_shuntaro
body: The protagonist of the manga "[[Tsukiji Uogashi Sandaime]]". He is a former bank employee who, without any knowledge of the business, takes over as the third generation of "Uotatsu", a fish wholesaler in Tsukiji Fish Market, following in the footsteps of his father-in-law. He is commonly referred to as "Sandaime" (lit. "the third generation") by those around him. With his inherent cheerfulness, love for food, and curiosity, he solves various problems that arise through Tsukiji and fish. The manga has also been adapted into a film, with Oosawa Takao playing the role of Shuntaro.

body:
A Link-5 [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]], primarily used to remove opponent's monster by using them as one of her summoning materials. As her name implies, she is based on the Sumerian goddess Ereshkigal.

She has [[black hair|black]] [[medium hair]] with [[pale skin]] and [[red eyes]], wearing a black [[gothic lolita]] [[dress]]. She is often accompanied by an black [[dragon]] named "Kur" in the background.

title: goutokuji_mike
body: Lucky Charm for Prosperous Commerce Goutokuji Mike (pronounced "mee-keh") is the 1st stage boss of [[Touhou]] 18 [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She is a [[Maneki-Neko]] with [[calico]] colorings. With the appearance of a [[cat_girl|humanoid cat]], she has [[short_hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]] with [[multicolored_hair|several brown and orange stains]] following the calico pattern acomodated in [[bangs]]; same pattern goes in her [[cat_ears|ears]] and [[cat_tail|tail]]. She has [[orange eyes]], and wears a [[crop top]] and a [[medium_skirt|skirt]] all covered in [[patch]]. Off her neck hangs a [[jingle bell]], while on her feet she wears [[barefoot|nothing at all]]. She holds a [[gold|golden]] [[koban_(gold)|koban]] [[coin]], with the words [b]千万両[/b] written in it, meaning in Chinese [i]"ten million tael"[/i], as part of her maneki-neko characterization. She is often drawn with her arms doing a [[paw pose]]. h4. See also * [[Goutokuji Mike (Cat)]] * "Nyan Clan of Gensokyo":/pools/17046 h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mike_Goutokuji

title: kawamori_shouji
body:
河森正治 [b]Kawamori Shōuji[/b] (born February 2, 1960 in Toyama, Japan) is a renowned japanese anime creator, screenwriter and designer, having created or co-created such notable series as [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]], [[Tenkuu no Escaflowne]], [[Earth Girl Arjuna]], [[Sousei no Aquarion]], [[Macross 7]], [[Macross Frontier]], [[Basquash!]], [[AKB0048]] and [[Macross Delta]]. He directed the anime film [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] in 1984, when he was only 24 years old.

Kawamori attended Keio University in the same years as Macross screenwriter Ōnogi Hiroshi and character designer [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]] (where they had a [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] fanclub called "Gunsight-1"). He occasionally used the alias 黒河影次 Kurokawa Eiji early in his career when he started as a member of Studio Nue. 

Kawamori Shouji is also an accomplished visual artist and [[mecha]] designer. Some of his early anime works include designs for [[Techno Police 21C]], [[Ulysses 31]] and [[Crusher Joe]]. He may be best known as the designer of the legendary [[VF-1]] [b]Valkyrie[/b] from [[MACROSS]] and the original [b]Convoy[/b] ([[Optimus Prime]]) toy for [[Transformers]]. 

Each and every variable fighter from the Macross series (except those from [[Macross 2]]) was created by him. 

These and other designs have established Kawamori as a (perhaps the) master of transforming mecha. He’s also known for designing the [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] and the [[Gundam GP-02 Physalis]] from [[Gundam 0083]]. Kawamori has also created designs for videogames like [[Choukou Senki Kikaiou]] ([[Rafaga]]) and the [[Armored Core]] series. He still works with Studio Nue on certain projects. The majority of his designs are sleek and aerodynamic although he’s quite versatile – many people have trouble identifying Kawamori designs. He is sought after as a mecha designer and has worked on a large variety of projects and continues to produce and direct anime TV series and OVA’s.

Kawamori is currently executive director at the animation studio Satelight. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, ecological concern... and lots of music idols. 

h4. Famous Designs:

* [[Optimus Prime]] G1 Design ([[Transformers]])
* [[VF-1]] Valkyrie ([[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]])
* [[Gundam GP-02 Physalis]] ([[Gundam 0083]])
* [[YF-19]] Alpha One ([[Macross Plus]])
* [[VF-19]] [[Fire Valkyrie]] ([[Macross 7]])
* [[VF-25]] Messiah ([[Macross Frontier]])
* [[Solar Aquarion]] ([[Sousei No Aquarion]])

h4. See also

* [[Kawamori Shouji (style)]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":http://www.satelight.co.jp/kawamori

title: interface_censor
body:
A [[novelty censor]] or [[convenient censoring]] that uses elements of a [[user interface]] or [[heads-up display]].

[[Outside of Play Area]] is a common example of this kind of censorship.

title: outside_of_play_area
body:
When users of [[PlayStation VR]] tilt their angle at a compromising position or go beyond play range (more commonly on the former), the user is greeted with a black screen (or black superimposition) and the message "Outside of Play Area" (プレイエリアの外です - Play Area [i]no soto desu[/i]).

Often used as an [[interface censor]], even for [[pantyshot|pantyshots]], to enforce modesty. The latter is a prominent case usage of the censorship, already seen in PSVR games.

There is no workaround currently for this kind of censorship.

h4. External links

* "PS VR: Tracking issues":https://www.playstation.com/en-gb/get-help/help-library/accessories/controller--headset---playstation-camera/ps-vr--tracking-issues/
other_names: プレイエリアの外です

title: john_moses_browning
body:
[b]John Moses Browning[/b] (January 23, 1855 – November 26, 1926) was a prolific American [[gun|firearm]] designer. Some of his designs were the [[Colt-Browning M1895]], [[Browning M1919]], [[Browning M2]], [[M1918 BAR]] [[machine gun]]s, [[Browning Auto 5]] [[shotgun]], the [[M1911]] and [[Browning Hi-Power]] [[handgun]]s.

* [[Tag Group:People]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: John Browning":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Browning
other_names: ジョン・ブローニング

title: colt-browning_m1895
body:
The [b]Colt-Browning M1895[/b] is an American belt-fed [[machine gun]] designed by [[John Moses Browning|John Browning]] and his brother Matthew S. Browning, designed from 1898 to 1895. Nicknamed "potato digger" due its unusual mechanism.
The [[weapon]] is recognizable by its rear handle like the later Browning M1919, rectangular body shape, [[flip-up sight|flip-up rear sight]], and often mounted on [[tripod]]s, wheeled carriages or vehicles.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1895 CB (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Colt-Browning M1895":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1895_Colt–Browning_machine_gun

title: star_wars:_visions
body:
A collection of animated [[Star Wars]] shorts. Released exclusively for Disney+ on September 22, 2021, with a second season released on May 4, 2023.

The first batch was animated exclusively by Japanese studios, while the second features studios from around the world.

title: takahashi_ryousuke
body:
The older of the Takahashi brothers.

Cold, calculated and analytical, Ryousuke nurtures his brother [[takahashi_keisuke|Keisuke]] into gradually improving as a racing driver. Despite his somewhat mathematical outward persona, he is quite affable and seems to exude a charming aura. Nicknamed "Akagi's White Comet" due to his insane speed and driving skill when at the wheel of his all white [[Mazda rx-7 FC|FC3S]] [[Mazda RX-7]].

title: takahashi_keisuke
body:
The younger of the Takahashi brothers.

Somewhat impetuous and hot-headed, Keisuke is the hill-climb specialist for his brother [[Takahashi Ryousuke]]'s team. He is almost exclusively seen driving his own yellow FD3S [[Mazda RX-7]].

title: yana_(chihuri)
body:
[[Original]] character of [[chihuri]]. 16 years old. [[yuri|Dating and living together]] with [[zoya petrovna vecheslova|Zoya]]. 

Has [[very_long_hair|very long]], [[pink_hair|pink]] hair with a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]], [[brown eyes]], and [[stud earrings]]. She is usually seen wearing a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]] along with a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[black pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. She sometimes wears [[black gloves]] as well. Owns a [[teddy bear]] that she has with her when in bed.

title: revision
body:
An image that has been altered by the artist to make corrections to it. The changes may be minor (such as a missing mole) or they may be major (correcting for bad proportions, or adding censorship).

This tag should not be used unless there is a visual difference between the images. Images that differ only in resolution or compression level are [[duplicate]]s, not revisions.

It also should not be used if the original non-revised image doesn't exist on Danbooru.

If a post was completely redrawn, use [[redrawn]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[duplicate]]
* [[has bad revision]] (for when a revision is available, but it is inferior to the image already on Danbooru)
* [[has censored revision]] (for when a revision is available, but has been censored, most likely due to the artist accidentally posting an uncensored version)
* [[variant_set]]

title: dalvin_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[Scathach (Fire Emblem)|]]'s replacement/substitute in [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]] if [[Ayra (Fire Emblem)|]] was left unmarried or died before the end of the First Generation. Like many substitutes, he is notably inferior (stat-wise) to the character he replaces.

Notably, he is featured in the manga adaptation by Mitsuki Oosawa, being the only substitute character to do so, alongside his sister, [[Creidne (Fire Emblem)|]] (who is [[Larcei (Fire Emblem)|]]'s substitute.) Here, he is depicted as an early member of [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]]'s liberation army, who becomes disillusioned with the rebel cause, following Creidne's capture and death, and attempts to betray Seliph. He fails and is later put to death.

title: adeptus_mechanicus
body:
Subfaction [[warhammer 40k|Warhammer 40,000]]: they are a religious cult that venerate the Machine God as supreme being and consider the machine as the most perfect form attainable by the mankind.
Members always have  [[cyborg|mechanical augmentations]] (many times so heavy that they could be easily mistaken for robots). Usually their members wear [[red cloak|red]]  [[cloak|cloaks]] with a  [[hooded cloak|hood]]; in many depictions they could wear other types of robes, but always coloured of red (their holy planet is Mars, the Red Planet). 
Their emblema is a skull half human and half robotic.
Prior to Horus Heresy at millennium 31 were known as cult mechanicum.
WH40K fans love to joke about them having sex with toasters.

title: heresy
body:
Teachings or images that run contrary to the accepted dogma of the religion (or fandom, as the case may be here on Danbooru).

It is generally used in context of the [[Warhammer 40k]] franchise, where this refers to members of the Imperium of Man either going against the Imperial dogma or fighting alongside one of the many races that are against Mankind (or shagging with them). Within the fandom, this generally refers to either a [[genderswap]] of characters with skimpy clothing, or a removal of a character's charm point (i.e. giving [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]] a giant rack, or straightening [[Tanamachi Kaoru]]'s hair).

(Note: female Space Marines have been accepted into the 40k fandom via the [[Adepta Sororitas|Adeptas Sororitas]].)

title: waterwraith
body:
[b]Scientific name:[/b] [i]Amphibio sapiens[/i]

A truly bizarre and terrifying creature from [[Pikmin 2]]. Resembling a humanoid [[steamroller]] made from water, it is effortlessly able to roll over all of your [[Blue Pikmin]], since blues are the only pikmin you can bring to its cave, the Submerged Castle. And you can’t even harm it either, since as an [[ghost|apparition]], it is anchored to another dimension.

[spoiler]The above point about it being invincible is true until you reach the bottom of the Submerged Castle. There, [[candypop bud]]s can convert your Blues (and [[Bulbmin]]) into [[Purple Pikmin]], whose gravitational waves are capable of making the Waterwraith vulnerable. In fact, once you break its rollers, it becomes mostly harmless, and can be easily defeated then.[/spoiler]

The Waterwraith makes its return in [[Pikmin 4]], this time terrorizing a very similar cave called the Engulfed Castle.

h1. External links
* "Pikmin Wiki: Waterwraith":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Waterwraith]

title: toyota_ft-1
body:
A [[sports car]] concept presented by [[Toyota]] in 2014. The FT-1 would ultimately inspire the [[Toyota Supra Mk V|Mk V Supra]], though it's production successor had much different proportions due to it's shared [[BMW]] platform. The concept also featured an active aero [[spoiler (automobile)|]] that was cut from the production car, likely to keep the price within the target value of $60,000.

Despite not being a production vehicle, the FT-1 has appeared multiple times in the [[Gran Turismo]] series, both in it's original design and in [[racecar]] variants based on GT3 and [[Super GT]] GT500 regulations.

title: toyota_supra_mk_v
body:
The fifth generation of the [[Toyota Supra]]. Began production in 2020, reviving the Supra 18 years after the [[toyota supra mk iv|Mk IV]]'s discontinuation with a design based on the [[Toyota FT-1|FT-1]] concept car. Developed in partnership with [[BMW]], the Mk V uses the same platform as the [[BMW Z4|G29 Z4]] and shares many parts with its sibling.

Despite being a long-awaited revival of an iconic car, the Mk V Supra is controversial among many enthusiasts due it's reliance on BMW parts. Unlike the previous Supras, which used Toyota engines, the Mk V uses BMW-built engines and is constructed in Germany - leading many detractors to dismiss it as "merely a rebadged Z4."

"Wikipedia Article: Toyota GR Supra":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toyota_GR_Supra]

title: gangut_dva_(kancolle)
body:
[[Gangut (Kancolle)|]]'s dva (Cyrillic: два, meaning "two") form.

She wears her [[jacket_on_shoulders|jacket on her shoulders]], revealing her [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] red shirt and an [b] all black peaked cap[/b].
Her name reverts to her original Imperial Russian name of Gangut based on some sources (for their time like [i]Jane's Fighting Ships[/i], that state she reverted name in 1943/44 despite Russian sources stating otherwise).

title: oktyabrskaya_revolyutsiya_(kancolle)
body:
[b]Oktyabrskaya Revolyutsiya[/b] is the first remodel form of [i][[Gangut (kancolle)|]][/i] after her refitting as a Soviet ship. Russian for "October Revolution" (Cyrillic: Октябрьская революция).

The historical [i]Gangut[/i] joined the February Revolution in March 1917 following the Baltic Fleet mutiny. She received her new name and was laid up due to a lack of manpower in November 1918 before her recommission in March 1926 and partial reconstruction in October 1931.

After seeing limited action during the Winter War, she was damaged three times by German bombers during World War 2. After repairs and various upgrades, she supported the Red Army during the 1944 counteroffensive against Germany. She was rewarded with the Order of the Red Banner in July 1944. She was reclassified as a training ship in 1954 before being decommissioned on February 1956 and slowly scrapped.

Oktyabrskaya Revolyutsiya is very similar in appearance to Gangut, in that she has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes|red]]/[[orange eyes]]. She also wears a [[white jacket]] with [[belt]] over a [[red shirt]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. The key difference is that she wears a [[peaked cap]] with [b]a black crown and red visor[/b].

body: A mecha-themed, all-female shooting game by Chinese studio Flashwing. An evolution of the original [[Artery Gear]], the game came into being as its own IP after a set of nasty lawsuits ended up splitting Flashwing in half. It is a more direct evolution of the shooter gameplay of the original Armor Girls, while [[Artery Gear: Fusion]] went in a different direction. Final Gear is, as noted, a separate IP from Artery Gear, and does not feature the same characters.

title: scrapper_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science fiction]] franchise.

[b]Scrapper[/b] is an evil [i][[Constructicon]][/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient green, grey and black [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a bright green wheeled payloader [[truck]] with some resemblance to a Caterpillar CAT 966C.

Scrapper is the leader of the Constructions.

Motto: [i]"My work is a monument to -and made of- my enemies...".[/i]

title: pile_bunker
body:

An armor-piercing spike just like a pile driver hammered into enemy's armor plate by an explosive charge or electrical power. Other Pilebunker weapons require a [[bullet]] to use its exceed force and eject the shell casing from said weapon.

title: vincent_(fnaf_au)
body:
The identity of the Purple Man/[[William Afton]] in Rebornica's [i][[Five Nights at Freddy's]][/i] early illustrations. 

Depictions of the Vincent variation of Purple Man often include a lanky figure, a [[low ponytail]], and empty [[white eyes]]. While Vincent was originally drawn with a [[goatee]] and as fully purple, some fanart do without either.

The character design was later retooled into the player character of [i]Night Terror[/i], a videogame in Rebornica's later webcomic [i]Pilot[/i].

title: asymmetrical_one-piece_swimsuit
body:
A [[one-piece swimsuit]] with an asymmetrical design.

One very common asymmetrical design is a one-piece with only one shoulder strap. This is known as a [i]"one shoulder"[/i] swimsuit. Other examples include one side of the swimsuit solely having cutouts, a single diagonal strap link, or one side made out of straps.

Colors, patterns and [[print swimsuit]]s does not count as "asymmetrical design." Use [[two-tone one-piece swimsuit]] instead.

title: sol_badguy
body:
Main character from [[Guilty Gear]] and a rival of [[Ky Kiske]]. He is also known as "The Immoral Flame". He is an aloof bounty hunter who is overly blunt and easily annoyed. However, deep down in heart, he is not a bad person. He is a fan of the rock band [[Queen (band)|]] and enjoys listening to their music, which inspired the series' hard rock and heavy metal soundtrack.

He is, in fact, [spoiler][[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]]'s father conceived with [[Justice (Guilty Gear)|]], which makes him Ky's father-in-law and [[Sin Kiske]]'s grandfather. Neither Sol nor Ky took this revelation well once they realized it.[/spoiler]

* [[Order-Sol]]

title: ky_kiske
body:
[[Sol Badguy]]'s rival and the other main character from the [[Guilty Gear]] series. He is the former leader of the Sacred Order of Holy Knights and is the chief of the International Police Force. He is dedicated to God and works to maintain peace after the holy war. Although he morally sees only in black and white and not in shades of grey, and is easily manipulated by unseen workers from the holy war, he is working to adjust.

By [[Guilty Gear 2]], he has been elected High King of Illyria, became the husband of [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]] and fathered a son; [[Sin Kiske]].

title: sin_kiske
body:
A character from the [[Guilty Gear]] series and the son of [[Ky Kiske]] and [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]]. Due to being one-quarter Gear, Sin is fully grown by the age of three, but is still emotionally immature. He travels with [[Sol Badguy]], who has become a grudging mentor to Sin.

He uses a flag and pole as a weapon and has a massive appetite.

title: crying_child's_brother_(fnaf)
body:
The teenage older brother of the [[Crying Child (fnaf)|]] in [i][[Five Nights at Freddy's 4]][/i]. A mean-spirited prankster and a bully to the Child, who sometimes gets his friends to join in on the humiliation. [spoiler]He and his friends are ultimately responsible for the Child's head injury when they shoved the Child's head into the mouth of a Fredbear animatronic. The brother is at least remorseful for this.[/spoiler]

Fans speculate that the brother is actually [[Michael Afton]].

title: shimura_shinpachi
body:
A [i][[Gintama]][/i] character. One of the heirs to the Shimura clan dojo and the younger brother of [[Shimura Tae]]. The series tsukkomi. Most jokes about him center around his [[glasses]] being his most memorable trait. Works in the Yorozuya with [[Sakata Gintoki]] and [[Kagura (gintama)|]]. Knew [[Obi Hajime]] in his youth.

Actually loosely based off of the [[Shinsengumi]] captain [[Nagakura Shinpachi]], but while he is affiliated with his series' [[shinsengumi (gintama)|equivalent]] to them, he is not a member of the organization.

title: qui-gon_jinn
body:
Qui-Gon Jinn is a character from the [[Star Wars]] saga, played by Liam Neeson. He is a main character in the prequel film trilogy, serving as one of the protagonists of [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace| The Phantom Menace]] (1999).

[spoiler]During the Battle of Naboo, Qui-Gon and his padawan [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] confronted the [[sith]] [[Darth Maul]] together. While they initially managed to fend off the Sith Lord, Maul kills Qui-Gon.[/spoiler]

title: atf
body:
The Bureau of [b]A[/b]lcohol, [b]T[/b]obacco, [b]F[/b]irearms and Explosives (BATFE) is a domestic law enforcement agency within the [[United States|US]] Department of Justice. Its responsibilities include the investigation and prevention of the unlawful use, manufacture, and possession of [[gun|firearms]] and [[explosive]]s; acts of [[arson]] and [[bomb]]ings; including illegal trafficking of [[alcohol]] and [[tobacco]] products.

Sometimes humorously referred to as AFT after a certain US president referred to ATF as "the AFT" multiple times.

h1. External links
* "Official website":https://www.atf.gov
* "Wikipedia: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bureau_of_Alcohol,_Tobacco,_Firearms_and_Explosives

title: monster_girl_saga
body:
A combination of isekai and harem story, written by Anonymoose and based in the world of monster girl encyclopedia. It revolves around the main character being "magically transported to a world of miracles and magic, full of all manner of creatures from folklore that have metamorphosed into beautiful women for reasons unknown, where a great conflict is brewing between the newly-crowned Monster Lord, and the old "order," who wish to eliminate the monsters and return the world to its pre-metamorphosis state."

MGS is best known for its extreme length- the story has been written continuously for a decade, and is now seven volumes long (over 120 chapters.) It can be read here: http://anonymoosesaga.pbworks.com/w/page/67867177/Introduction

title: dishwasher
body:
A kitchen appliance for [[dishwashing|washing dishes]], cutlery, and cookware.  May be a large appliance around the same size as an oven, or a small counter unit the size of a microwave.  It features one or more racks for dishes.  When turned on the machine will automatically dispense dish detergent and use sprayers to wash the dishes clean.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dishwasher":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dishwasher]

title: arion_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Arion[/b] (アリオーン [i]Areone[/i]) is an antagonist in [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]’s 2nd Generation, who is the son of [[Travant (Fire Emblem)|]] and inheritor of the lance [[Gungnir (Fire Emblem)|]]. He’s also [[Altena (Fire Emblem)|]]’s stepbrother.

In [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]], it is revealed that he is engaged to [[Linoan (Fire Emblem)|]], a woman from Tahra.

He bears a strong resemblance to his father, having [[long hair|long]], [[green hair]], a [[black_coat]] with two large [[pauldrons]], and a [[two-tone cape]] that is black on the outside and red on the inside.

Holy Blood: [b]Dainn[/b] (Major)

title: fee_(fire_emblem)
body: Playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]'s 2nd Generation. Daughter of [[Erinys (Fire Emblem)|]] and younger sister of [[Ced (Fire Emblem)|]].

title: ced_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Ced[/b] (セティ, [i]Sety[/i]) is a character from the second generation of [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]], and appears in [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]] as an endgame ally. The son of [[Erinys (Fire Emblem)|Erinys]] and brother of [[Fee (Fire Emblem)|Fee]], Ced is renowned throughout Munster as a hero who will save the land from King Bloom's tyrannical regime.

[[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776|Thracia 776]] canonized Ced as the son of [[Lewyn (Fire Emblem)|Prince Lewyn]], making him a full-blooded descendant of the Crusader for which he was named, the crown prince of Silesse, and the inheritor of the [[Forseti (tome)|Book of Forseti]].

Holy Blood: [b]Forseti[/b] (major)

title: izanagi's_burden_(destiny)
body:
An exotic [[Sniper Rifle]] from [[Destiny (game)|Destiny 2]].

The magnum opus of the Black Armory, The Izanagi's Burden serves as both a key to the Black Armory's final secrets, the Bergusia Forge, and Project: Niobe, containing the final memories of [[Ada-1|Adelaide Meyrin]] and her mother, before the former was turned into an [[android|Exo]].

title: l129a1
body:
A semi-automatic [[designated marksman rifle]] manufactured by Lewis Machine and Tool Company chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. Typically comes in a brown/tan color. It also comes with an adjustable stock, a [[scope]], and a detachable [[bipod]]. Currently in service with the [[british_army|British Armed Forces]] and the New Zealand Army.

title: mystery_skulls
body:
An indie pop/electronica act done by Luis Dubuc, debuting with the single "Amazing" on his self-titled album in 2011.

His music has a well-known series of music videos known as [i][b]Mystery Skulls Animated[/b][/i], featuring a team of [i]Scooby-Doo[/i] style paranormal investigators and their dealings with wrathful spirits. The videos are made by a team of animators led by MysteryBen27, and have updated every 1-2 years.
